instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01521A Liquid spill
threads.message:
Hi guys, come in this macbook already inspected from another store.
Customer report liquid spill near fingerprint button. Motherboard seems to be in good shape.
Starts with 5v then it goes to 20v normally.
PPBUS_G3H 12,5v
PP3v3_G3H 3,3v
It's my first time on a t2 machine so i really don't know how it works and how it boots.
RIO CARD get damn hot in few seconds, no way to keep it connected (found a damage on flat connector, posted image).
No image on internal and external video. Where i should start?

Thank you in advance.
Dave

threads.title: 820-01521A Liquid spill
threads.message: Yes, It j6100 RIO side of course.

threads.title: 820-01521A Liquid spill
threads.message:
There are some T2 lines, probably damaged now.
Looks like hopeless project, sorry...
